result.execSummary:
The defendant Don Christopher Reinbold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Cause Mental/BodilyHarm, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(5).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED. Vocational/educational training.

No contact with C.M. and her family.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years.

Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor; and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs, surcharges, and assessments.    To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to Extended Supervision but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.
*Restitution set at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Don Christopher Reinbold

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (44 pages) commencing 06/18/2015 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3 AND 4:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in counts 2, 3 and 4 granted by the court.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Kevin N.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 97 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No contact with C.M. and her family
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay all costs and surcharges

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  

Court ordered restitution set at $0.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
jad

AS TO COUNT 1:
State's motion to amend offense dates in count 1 to May 1, 2008 to September 1, 2009 granted by the court.

Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 4:
Joint motion to allow defendant to vacate pleas entered in counts 2 and 4 granted by the court.

Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in counts 1 and 3 granted by the court.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, State's Notice of Intent to Introduce Videotaped Statements of Witnesses Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 908.08.
jad

Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial in Branch 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Don Christopher Reinbold not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Case is adjourned for motion hearing, final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 10.  Filed, signed Felony Motion/Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CN dob 1/24/01; Christopher N dob 6/28/99; Brandon N dob 8/11/98 Lauren B.; Diamond B. or Kevin N dob 7/11/72

Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
